issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is not completely described.
resolution.name: Incomplete

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
A fresh copy of ActiveMQ does not start up properly on my pc (Phenom II X2 550, WinXP Prof SP3). But it does on my notebook (IBM ThinkPad T61, Centrino Duo, WinXP Prof SP3).

Comparing the logs of both installations it seems to happen near or after 'DEBUG | starting JettyFactoryBean@183e7de | org.mortbay.log | main'.  While the notebooks proceeds with 'DEBUG | started
org.mortbay.jetty.nio.SelectChannelConnector$1@197871d | org.mortbay.log | main' the computer directly starts with 'DEBUG | Checkpoint started.' and 'DEBUG | Checkpoint done.' cycle. The admin web gui is not available.

Output of cmd shell of my pc:

fields.summary: ActiveMQ and/or embedded Jetty get stuck after "starting JettyFactoryBean"
fields.environment:
AMD Phenom II X2 550
Windows XP Professional SP3

comments.body: Any movement on this issue?  I've just experienced it on redhat linux.  Doing a clean install of activemq produced the same results.  The only way to get the broker to startup was to comment out the <include src="jetty.xml"/> in the activemq.xml.
can you post a thread stack dump of the broker that does not start correctly?

Hi,

I wonder if it may be the case of problem introduced in 5.3.1 release. See the proposed workaround at the top of this page - http://activemq.apache.org/web-console.html (at least in Jonathan's case). In any case, stack trace would be really useful.
Not enough data provided to investigate, stack traces needed.
